description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Windows graphics component elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-38249), apply the relevant updates for your version of Windows as described below:

1. Identify your system's build number from the list below:
   - Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.26100.1742
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22631.4169
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22621.4169
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: 10.0.22000.3197
   - For Windows 10 for x64-based and 32-bit Systems: 10.0.10240.20766 or versions 21H2 and 22H2 according to your architecture.

2. Download and install the appropriate KB updates from the links provided:
   - [Windows 11 Version 24H2: KB5043080](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043080)
   - [Windows 11 Version 23H2: KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
   - [Windows 11 Version 22H2: KB5043076](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043076)
   - [Windows 11 Version 21H2: KB5043067](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043067)
   - [Windows 10 for x64-based: KB5043083](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043083)
   - [Windows 10 for 32-bit: KB5043083](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5043083)
   - Additional updates for other versions can be found at the same source links.

**Details**:
This fix addresses a specific elevation of privilege vulnerability present in the Windows graphics component, which if exploited, can allow attackers to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges. Ensure compatibility by referencing the build numbers before proceeding with the installations.

**Preconditions**:
- Confirm your Windows version and build number.
- Backup sensitive data before proceeding with the updates.
